subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Beginner
msgSnippet: ... I would start with the getting started material http://junit.sourceforge.net/ Once you can write and run a test, one book I would definitely recommend is
messageBody:
--- sgiri1981 <sgiri1981@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
> I have been working on JAVA projects and now we want
> to do automated
> testing using JUnit.
> We will be working on Eclipse 3.0.1.
>
> For this task, can anyone suggest some reading
> material/best
> practices-- from a beginner's pt of view.
>
> regards
> S.Giri

I would start with the "getting started" material

http://junit.sourceforge.net/

Once you can write and run a test, one book I would
definitely recommend is Test Driven Development by
Example - Kent Beck. It walks through a simple Money
example (test-first) in Java. There are some patterns
for testing. I think u may still find a copy of the
draft in the files section on the TDD mailing list
which would give u an idea of the book's worth.

I haven't yet read JUnit Recipes : Practical Methods
for Programmer Testing by J. B. Rainsberger, but if it
has an just an ounce of the advice that J.B. shares on
this list, then it would be a "must". And one
reviewer states it "can quickly take anyone from
novice to expert at JUnit." It's a book I should
probably buy soon :-)

Cheers
Shane
